The user requested the addition of a "Submit" button to their project. The AI acknowledged the request and stated it was working on it. The user specified that the button should either be positioned at the bottom-center of the screen or at the top-right corner and should either send form data to a server with a confirmation message or open a new page with blockchain information submission guidelines. Additionally, the AI provided a checklist of possible features for the project, including a search functionality for blockchain news, real-time notifications for breaking news, a 'Favorite' button for saving articles, a user profile section, a dark/light mode toggle, and a feedback button. The user had already selected certain features from this list.

Following this, the user asked for another button that says "Hello World." The AI responded affirmatively, stating it would add this button and inquired for more details about the project. The user was presented with options regarding the button's positioning—in the main menu or as a floating action button at the bottom of the screen—and asked whether it should display a pop-up message or navigate the user to another screen with information.
